choices.D: Disables all the non-heartbeat interfaces in all the HA members for two seconds after a failover.
choices.B: Sends an ARP packet to all connected devices, indicating that the HA virtual MAC address is reachable through a new master after a failover.
choices.C: Sends a link failed signal to all connected devices.
choices.A: Forces the former primary device to shut down all its non-heartbeat interfaces for one second while the failover occurs.

questions.question_text: An administrator has configured two FortiGate devices for an HA cluster. While testing the HA failover, the administrator noticed that some of the switches in the network continue to send traffic to the former primary unit. The administrator decides to enable the setting link-failed-signal to fix the problem. Which statement is correct regarding this command?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
# get router info routing-table all
Routing table for VRF=0
S* 0.0.0.0/0 [10/0] via 192.168.2.1, port2
 [10/0] via 172.16.151.1, port1, [5/0]
C 172.16.151.0/24 is directly connected, port1
C 192.168.2.0/24 is directly connected, port2
Result:
Both routes are added to the routing table, but traffic is routed to port2 which has a lower priority value with a default of 0.

Fortinet Documentation.
Answer is C. Port 1
A is 100%. fortigate has ECMP by default
The correct is C because prioriry is 0 for port1

There might be an error in the exhibit. Should say prio=10, not prio=0 for port2.
So correct is C.
C is the correct answer, because the port1 has lower priority which is 0.

comments.content: FIB will be checked first before the RIB, as I can see on the output this should be A

choices.A: IP addresses are in the same subnet.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
A B C are correct
Agree on A,B,C. It is not even FortiGate related but just general OSPF rules.
A, B and C are correct

the correct answer is A,B,C 
page 281 on study guide 6.4

questions.question_text: What conditions are required for two FortiGate devices to form an OSPF adjacency? (Choose three.)
How does FortiManager handle FortiGuard requests from FortiGate devices, when it is configured as a local FDS?

choices.A: FortiManager can download and maintain local copies of FortiGuard databases.
choices.C: FortiManager will respond to update requests only if they originate from a managed device.
choices.B: FortiManager supports only FortiGuard push to managed devices.
choices.D: FortiManager does not support rating requests.

choices.A: It inspects incoming traffic to protect services in the corporate DMZ.
choices.B: It is the first line of defense at the network perimeter.
choices.D: It is an all-in-one security appliance that is placed at remote sites to extend the enterprise network.
choices.C: It splits the network into multiple security segments to minimize the impact of breaches.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct
